Gilberto Reynoso Meza

Bolsista de Produtividade em Pesquisa do CNPq - Nível 2

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/1888359548640986
  • Última atualização do currículo em 10/09/2019

Gilberto Reynoso Meza received his PhD in Automation from the Universitat Politècnica de València (Spain) and his B.Sc. (2001) in Mechanical Engineering from the Tecnológico de Monterrey, Campus Querétaro (México). Currently he is with the Industrial and Systems Engineering Graduate Program (PPGEPS) of the Pontifical Catholic University of Parana (PUCPR), Brazil as an Associate Professor. His main research interests are computational intelligence methods for control engineering, multi-objective optimisation, many-objectives optimisation, multi-criteria decision making, evolutionary algorithms and machine learning. He holds a productivity grant PQ2 by CNPQ, Brazil and a research distiction SNI-1 by the CONACyT, México.

ORCiD: 0000-0002-8392-6225
Scopus: K-2151-2012
Twitter: @gilreyme
Matlab Central: File Exchange

Projetos de pesquisa
2018 - Atual
DPI2017-82896-C2-1-R : DISEÑO, CARACTERIZACION Y AJUSTE OPTIMO DE BIOCIRCUITOS SINTETICOS PARA BIOPRODUCCION CON CONTROL DE CARGA METABOLICA
Descrição: This project aims to merge systems engineering, and bioprocess engineering. Its ultimate goal is to design and characterise synthetic biological systems and optimise them to perform an specific task..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Gilberto Reynoso Meza - Integrante / Jesús Picó - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Ministerio de Economía y Competitividad, Gobierno de España - Auxílio financeiro.
2018 - Atual
[CNPq UNIVERSAL 437105/2018-0] Engineering design with multiobjective optimisation techniques
Descrição: System design is a complex task when design parameters have to meet a combined number of specifications or design objectives which are usually conflicting. System design can be understood as the search for the best compromise among all the required specifications. Problems in which the designer must deal with the fulfilment of multiple objectives are known as multi-objective problems. In this project using Multi-objective Optimisation approaches for engineering systems design is proposed, in order to improve their overall performance. The main difference between multi-objective optimisation and classical optimisation approaches is that the latter seeks for a single solution describing the expected trade-off; the former seeks for a potential sets of solutions, with different trade-off. The multi-objective approach is a valuable tool that could provide an advantage to the designer if: 1) It is difficult to find a reasonable trade-off for a solution fulfilling several requirements; this is because with a set of potential solutions, the designer might ponder strengths and drawbacks of each proposal in order to select the most preferable for the current application. 2) It is worthwhile analysing design objectives exchange in an overall sense. This might lead to a better understanding of the design problem, and thus extracting additional knowledge from the problem, useful for designers. Using a multi-objective optimisation approach for systems design requires three fundamental steps: the multi-objective problem definition, the multi-objective optimisation process and the multi-criteria decision making stage. This integral and holistic process will be denoted hereafter as a Multi-objective Optimisation Design (MOOD) procedure. This project support the PQ project entitled: Multi-objective optimisation design (MOOD) procedures for engineering systems, process 304066/2016-8, running from 03/2017 to 03/2020. In such project four key areas are addressed: knowledge transfer, Unmanned Aerial Systems, Mechatronic devices and Industrial applications (See Figure below). This project focuses on the first key area, knowledge transfer, by giving support regarding the use of MOOD procedures for design problems to the international network within the project..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (1) / Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Gilberto Reynoso Meza - Coordenador / Leandro dos Santos Coelho - Integrante / Roberto Zanetti - Integrante / Alejandro Vignoni - Integrante / Victor Henrique Alves Ribeiro - Integrante / Lenin, Lemus - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico - Bolsa / Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico - Auxílio financeiro.
2017 - Atual
[ CNPq | PQ2 | 304066/2016-8 ] : Multi-objective optimisation design (MOOD) procedures for engineering systems. Industrial applications, unmanned aerial systems and mechatronic devices.
Descrição: System design is a complex task when design parameters have to meet a combined number of specifications or design objectives which are usually conflicting. System design can be understood as the search for the best compromise among all the required specifications. Problems in which the designer must deal with the fulfilment of multiple objectives are known as multi-objective problems. In this project using Multi-objective Optimisation approaches for engineering systems design is proposed, in order to improve their overall performance. This project is the continuation of a project that has expired (BJT-400257/2014-9: New Evolutionary Multiobjective Optimization techniques for multidisciplinary optimization design for automotive and aeronautic applications.), and it is partially funded by the CNPq (Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico), Brazil..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (3) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Gilberto Reynoso Meza - Coordenador / Victor Henrique Alves Ribeiro - Integrante / FERREIRA DA CRUZ, ALEXANDRE - Integrante / RODRIGO MONTEIRO, WELLINGTON - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico - Bolsa.
2017 - Atual
H2020-727583 : Advanced materials and processes to improve performance and cost-efficiency of Shallow Geothermal systems and Underground Thermal Storage (GEOCOND)
Descrição: By a smart combination of different material solutions under the umbrella of sophisticated engineering, optimisation, testing and on-site validation, the GEOCOND project is developing solutions to increase the thermal performance of the different subsystems configuring an SGES and UTES. The overall aim of the project is to reduce the costs by about 25%, leading to a substantial gain in competitiveness through the development of new pipe materials, advanced grouting additives and concepts, advanced phase change materials and system-wide simulation and optimisation..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Gilberto Reynoso Meza - Integrante / Javier Urchueguía - Coordenador.
2016 - 2019
DPI2015-71443: Desarrollo de herramientas avanzadas para metodologías de diseño y optimización multiobjetivo en ingeniería de control. Aplicación a sistemas multivariables.
Descrição: DPI2015-71443, MINECO, Spanish Goverment.

The project aims, firstly, to develop advanced tools to apply the methodology of multi-objective optimization in the design of control systems for complex multivariable processes and, secondly, to advance in the development of multivariable controllers, making emphasis on model-based predictive controllers (widely used in process industry). Additionally, all results will be validated in relevant applications in various fields of engineering, especially energy and transport. In particular, developments will be tested on PEM fuel cells systems (both static and mobile applications) and issues related to the search for optimum operating points, energy management in vehicles, trajectory optimization, etc. In its scientific aspect, the project will seek to provide innovative solutions in the three key components of a multi-objective optimization problem: at the objectives selection trying to bring them closer to the needs of the designer; at the optimization phase in improving algorithms to cope with a large number of variables and constraints; and at the phase of decision making, improving the incorporation of designer preferences and the multidimensional visualization. Moreover, applying multiobjective tools to the design of multivariable controllers aims to achieve an intuitive and interpretable tuning, especially when control problems have many constraints. In particular, model based predictive control or MPC will be used as control methodology, which besides being a technology with great industrial acceptance, it keeps a close relationship with optimization. Similarly, given the importance of models and virtual sensors when you want to control complex multivariable processes, multiobjective methodology will also apply for achieving progress in the quality and reliability of dynamic models and the development of virtual sensors..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Gilberto Reynoso Meza - Integrante / MARTINEZ, MIGUEL - Integrante / Xavier Blasco Ferragud - Coordenador / Sergio García-Nieto - Integrante / Javier Sanchis Saez - Integrante / Herrero Dura, Juan Manuel - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Ministerio de Economía y Competitividad, Gobierno de España - Auxílio financeiro.
2016 - Atual
DPI2016-77271-R: Control and operation strategies for greenhouse gas emissions mitigation: application to wastewater treatment plants
Descrição: GEMCO proposal is motivated by the application of engineering expertise to solve specific problems related to the climate change. As with other industry processes, Wastewater Treatment Plants (WWTP) can emit gases that are harmful to the climate, such as nitrous oxide (N2O), carbon dioxide (CO2), and methane (CH4). The traditional main goal of a WWTP, i.e., to meet effluent standards to protect the receiving water body, requires a broadening in scope if a reduction of GHG emissions is desired. This is the reasoning behind GEMCO, an application driven project with its main focus on several challenging methodological problems that have just arisen with the operation of WWTP and that encompass the need to interface different disciplines such as environmental engineering, control and operation, multicriteria optimization and decision as well as biochemical engineering. GEMCO will apply control and optimization methods for WWTP operation enhancement, with an emphasis on the environmental impact from the point of view of GHG emissions and global warming potential of operation actions. Within this context, the project will address the challenge of designing sustainable operation strategies for WWTP. This will be addressed by facing the following two operational problems within the wastewater treatment industry: - Synthesis of WWTP operation solutions for GHG mitigation under water quality constraints. - Carbon neutrality WWTP operation with minimal environmental impact..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Gilberto Reynoso Meza - Integrante / ARRIETA, O. - Integrante / Ramón Vilanova - Coordenador / Meneses, M - Integrante / Pedret, C. - Integrante / Ibeas, A. - Integrante / Ponsa, P. - Integrante / Barbu, M. - Integrante / Flores-Alsina, M - Integrante / Rojas, J.D. - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Ministerio de Economía y Competitividad, Gobierno de España - Auxílio financeiro.
2015 - 2017
DPI2014-55276-C5-1-R : Synthetic biology for bioproduction enhancement: Design, optimization, monitoring and control
Descrição: SynBioFactory is an application driven project targetting several challenging methodological problems in the interface between synthetic biology (SynBio), systems engineering, and bioprocess engineering. The project will apply SynBio for bioproduction enhancement, with an emphasis on the role that engineering design methods can play exploiting optimization, monitoring and feedback control. Its ultimate goal is to help SynBio to become an engineering discipline. SynBioFactory, thus, emphasizes engineering principles and methodology in designing, constructing and characterizing biological systems from traditional genetic engineering research..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Gilberto Reynoso Meza - Integrante / Alejandro Vignoni - Integrante / Jesús Picó - Coordenador / Enric Picó - Integrante / José Luis Navarro - Integrante / Hernán de Battista - Integrante / Diego Oyarzún - Integrante / Marta Tortajada - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Ministerio de Economía y Competitividad, Gobierno de España - Auxílio financeiro.
